location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 153: Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, HC Sloop Clive, off Bushire, to Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: This letter concerns the Lomherebugglah, which was seized by Lieutenant James Tronson, Commander of the HC brigantine, the Tigris, on 7 June, after it was discovered that the vessel was carrying two African slaves. Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, refers to Arnold Burrowes Kemball's letter of 6 September (no. 249), in which Kemball recommended that the bugglah be released. Robinson reports that the bugglah has been released. He forwards a copy of a declaration by the vessel's nacodah [nakhoda], Rashid ben Zaid, which states that he, Rashid ben Zaid, has no claims against the captors.
